xxl.core.indexStructures

Class Tree.Node

  • java.lang.Object
    • xxl.core.indexStructures.Tree.Node
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BPlusTree.Node, ORTree.Node, VariableLengthBPlusTree.Node
    Enclosing class:
    Tree

    public abstract class Tree.Node
extends Object
    Node is the class used to represent leaf- and non-leaf nodes. Nodes are stored in Containers.
    See Also:
    Tree.determineContainer, Tree.getContainer

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes

      class  Tree.Node.SplitInfo
      SplitInfo contains information about a split.

    • Field Detail

      • level

        public int level
        The maximum distance to the leaves of the subtree (i.e. for leaf level == 0).

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public Tree.Node initialize(int level)
        Initializes the Node by setting it's level.
        Parameters:
        level - the level of the Node
        Returns:
        the Node itself

      • initialize

        protected abstract Tree.Node.SplitInfo initialize(Object entry)
        Initializes the Node by inserting a new entry into it.
        Parameters:
        entry - the entry which has to be inserted
        Returns:
        SplitInfo which contains information about a possible split

      • redressOverflow

        protected Collection redressOverflow(Stack path)
        Treats overflows which occur during an insertion. It splits the overflowing node in new nodes and creates new index-entries for the new nodes. These index-entries will be returned as a Collection. The top Node on stack will be written into the storage and unfixed from the underlaying buffer. The method post(Tree.Node.SplitInfo, Tree.IndexEntry) will be used to post the created index-entries into the parent node.
        Parameters:
        path - the path from the root to the overflowing node
        Returns:
        a Collection containing all index-entries created by the split

      • redressOverflow

        protected Collection redressOverflow(Stack path,
                                     boolean up)
        Treats overflows which occur during an insertion. It splits the overflowing node in new nodes and creates new index-entries for the new nodes. These index-entries will be returned as a Collection. The method post(Tree.Node.SplitInfo, Tree.IndexEntry) will be used to post the created index-entries into the parent node.
        Parameters:
        path - the path from the root to the overflowing node
        up - signals whether the top Node on the stack will be written into the storage by calling Tree.update(Stack) and unfixed from the underlaying buffer.
        Returns:
        a Collection containing all index-entries created by the split

      • redressOverflow

        protected Collection redressOverflow(Stack path,
                                     List newIndexEntries)
        Treats overflows which occur during an insertion. It splits the overflowing node in new nodes and creates new index-entries for the new nodes. These index-entries will be added to the given List. The top node on stack will be written into the storage and unfixed from the underlaying buffer. The method post(Tree.Node.SplitInfo, Tree.IndexEntry) will be used to post the created index-entries to the parent node.
        Parameters:
        path - the path from the root to the overflowing node
        newIndexEntries - a List to carry the new index-entries created by the split
        Returns:
        a Collection which accrues from the given collection and the created index-entries during the split.

      • redressOverflow

        protected Tree.Node.SplitInfo redressOverflow(Stack path,
                                              Tree.Node parentNode,
                                              List newIndexEntries)
        Treats overflows which occur during an insertion. It splits the overflowing node in new nodes. It creates new index-entries for the new Nodes. These index-entries will be added to the given List. The method post(Tree.Node.SplitInfo, Tree.IndexEntry) will be used to post the created index-entries to the parent Node.
        Parameters:
        path - the path from the root to the overflowing node
        parentNode - the parent node of the overflowing node
        newIndexEntries - a List to carry the new index-entries created by the split
        Returns:
        a SplitInfo containing requiered information about the split

      • redressOverflow

        protected Collection redressOverflow(Stack path,
                                     List newIndexEntries,
                                     boolean up)
        Treats overflows which occur during an insertion. It splits the overflowing node in new nodes. It creates new index-entries for the new nodes. These index-entries will be be added to the given List. The method post(Tree.Node.SplitInfo, Tree.IndexEntry) will be used to post the created index-entries to the parent node.
        Parameters:
        path - the path from the root to the overflowing node
        newIndexEntries - a List to carry the new index-entries created by the split
        up - signals whether the top node on stack will be written into the storage by calling Tree.update(Stack path) and unfixed from the underlaying buffer by calling Tree.up(Stack path).
        Returns:
        a Collection which accrues from the given collection and the created index-entries during the split.

      • chooseSubtree

        protected abstract Tree.IndexEntry chooseSubtree(Descriptor descriptor,
                                                 Stack path)
        Chooses the subtree which is followed during an insertion.
        Parameters:
        descriptor - the Descriptor of data onject
        path - the path from the root to the current node
        Returns:
        the index entry refering to the root of the chosen subtree

      • chooseSubtree

        protected Tree.IndexEntry chooseSubtree(Object object,
                                        Stack path)
        Chooses the subtree which is followed during the insertion of object.
        Parameters:
        object - the object to be inserted. Its descriptor is used to choose the subtree
        path - the path from the root to the current node
        Returns:
        the index entry refering to the root of the chosen subtree
        See Also:
        chooseSubtree(Descriptor,Stack)

      • chooseSubtree

        protected Tree.IndexEntry chooseSubtree(Descriptor descriptor,
                                        Stack path,
                                        Function isValidEntry)
        Chooses the subtree which is followed during an insertion.
        Parameters:
        descriptor - the Descriptor of data object
        path - the path from the root to this node
        isValidEntry - Function (IndexEntry→Boolean) that determines whether an indexEntry may be chosen.
        Returns:
        the index entry refering to the root of the chosen subtree

      • chooseSubtree

        protected Tree.IndexEntry chooseSubtree(Descriptor descriptor,
                                        Stack path,
                                        Predicate isValidEntry)
        Chooses the subtree which is followed during an insertion.
        Parameters:
        descriptor - the Descriptor of the data object
        path - the path from the root to this node
        isValidEntry - Predicate (IndexEntry→boolean) that determines whether an indexEntry may be chosen
        Returns:
        the index entry refering to the root of the chosen subtree

      • chooseSubtree

        protected Tree.IndexEntry chooseSubtree(Object object,
                                        Stack path,
                                        Predicate isValidEntry)
        Chooses the subtree which is followed during an insertion.
        Parameters:
        object - the object to be inserted. Its descriptor is used to choose the subtree
        path - the path from the root to this node
        isValidEntry - Predicate (IndexEntry→boolean) that determines whether an indexEntry may be chosen
        Returns:
        The index-entry refering to the root of the chosen subtree

      • grow

        protected abstract void grow(Object data,
                             Stack path)
        Inserts an entry into the current node. If level>0 data must be an index entry.
        Parameters:
        data - the entry which has to be inserted into the node
        path - the path from the root to the current node

      • split

        protected abstract Tree.Node.SplitInfo split(Stack path)
        This method is used to split the next node on the stack in two nodes. The current node should be the empty new Node. The method distributes the entries of the overflowing Node to the both nodes.
        Parameters:
        path - the nodes already visited during this insert
        Returns:
        a SplitInfo containig all needed information about the split

      • post

        protected abstract void post(Tree.Node.SplitInfo splitInfo,
                             Tree.IndexEntry newIndexEntry)
        Updates the current node with the split information e.g. inserts the new index entry of the new node.
        Parameters:
        splitInfo - the information created by split
        newIndexEntry - the new index-entry refering to the new node created during the split

      • underflows

        protected boolean underflows()
        Returns true if the node contains fewer elements than the underflow conditions allow
        Returns:
        true if the node contains fewer elements than the underflow conditions allow, false otherwise

      • overflows

        protected boolean overflows()
        Returns true if the node contains more elements than the overflow conditions allow
        Returns:
        true if the node contains more elements than the overflow conditions allow, false otherwise

      • splitMinRatio

        protected double splitMinRatio()
        Calls the function getSplitMinRatio and cast the return value to double.
        Returns:
        the minimal relative number of entries which the node may contain after a split
        See Also:
        Tree.getSplitMinRatio

      • splitMaxRatio

        protected double splitMaxRatio()
        Calls the function getSplitMaxRatio and cast the return value to double.
        Returns:
        the maximal relative number of entries which the node may contain after a split.
        See Also:
        Tree.getSplitMaxRatio

      • splitMinNumber

        protected int splitMinNumber()
        Uses the method splitMinRatio to find out the minimal number of entries which the node may contain after a split.
        Returns:
        the minimal number of entries which the node may contain after a split

      • splitMaxNumber

        protected int splitMaxNumber()
        Uses the method splitMaxRatio to find out the maximal number of entries which the node may contain after a split.
        Returns:
        the maximal number of entries which the node may contain after a split
